comments.html: And of course I cannot help but agree with you, but my point was that people working on feature X obviously don't ask the questions "what's the attack surface of feature X?" and "how do we protect feature X?" (i.e. security is not an integral part of feature development).
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
I would argue that "too many features" is a good reason for "good old fashioned ignorance" -- if there are so many features that you can't even hope to know about them, and more are added every month/week/day, it's going to be difficult to see how anyone can be anything except ignorant about all of them.... :-)

Russ
